question_text: Which of the following are true about MAC addresses and NIC behavior? (Select all that apply)
answer_options: Each NIC has a unique factory-assigned MAC address
MAC addresses operate at the Data Link layer (Layer 2)
A NICâ€™s MAC address is used by routers for packet forwarding decisions
MAC filtering can be bypassed with spoofing techniques
MAC addresses are required for DNS resolution
correct_answer: Each NIC has a unique factory-assigned MAC address
MAC addresses operate at the Data Link layer (Layer 2)
MAC filtering can be bypassed with spoofing techniques
explanation: MAC addresses are Layer 2 identifiers burned into NICs. Routers forward based on IP, not MAC. DNS doesn't use MAC addresses.
